page.title: MINI.off() - Minified.js
page.main:
back to Overview

MINI.off()

Removes the event handler.

Syntax

MINI.off(handler)

Parameters

handler
the handler to unregister, as given to on(). It must be a handler that has previously been registered using on().

Description

Removes the event handler. The call will be ignored if the given handler has not registered using on(). If the handler has been registered for more than one element or event, it will be removed from all instances.

Example

Adds a handler to an element 
function myEventHandler() {
   this.style.backgroundColor = 'red';    // 'this' contains the element that caused the event
}
$('#myElement').on('click', myEventHandler);     // add event handler

window.setInterval(function() {                      // after 5s, remove event handler
   MINI.off(myEventHandler);
}, 5000);
